title: I’m not opposed to Maritime Varsity —Peterside

locations.name: warri south-west local government area of delta state

organizations.name: nigeria maritime administration and safety agency

text:
Home » News » I’m not opposed to Maritime Varsity —Peterside I’m not opposed to Maritime Varsity —Peterside On 3:16 am In News by Okogba Comments 
By Gbenga Oke & Aniema Umoh 
D irector-General of Nigeria Maritime Administration and Safety Agency, NIMASA, Dr. Dakuku Peterside, has denied reports that he was opposed to the Maritime University, Okerenkoko, in Warri South-West Local Government Area of Delta State. 
This came as a Niger Delta youth activist, Mr. Oweilaemi Pereotubo, took a swipe at Peterside, cautioning him to be mindful of his comments on the Maritime University. Dakuku Peterside 
Pereotubo who is one of the top contenders for the Ijaw Youth Council, IYC, Presidency warned that recent comments credited to Peterside, saying that it was not the mandate of the agency to set up the Maritime University, was capable of derailing the fragile peace in the Niger Delta region. 
Meanwhile, a statement by the Head, Corporate Communication , NIMASA, Mr. Isichei Osamgbi, denied reports that the agency was opposed to the establishment of the Maritime University at Okerenkoko. 
He said, “The benefits derivable from setting up the institution will be numerous. Apart from becoming a citadel for knowledge and development of human capital, job opportunities will be created for Nigerians, particularly the community.”
